item.title: 5 Enemy Types That Might Return In Silent Hill F
item.description:
Summary

  • Silent Hill f likely to have references to older games, but risks negating new setting advantages.
  • Speculation on new monsters and redesigns for Silent Hill f , with central stalkers expected.
  • Nurses, dogs, insects, and new monsters like Sakura Head can be expected in Silent Hill f .

While Silent Hill f is clearly making a bold move in departing far away from the titular town which has been the setting for the series, there is still a likelihood it will have references to the older Silent Hill games and certain commonalities will be shared. Certainly, by having too many callbacks and references to older games, Silent Hill f would risk negating the advantages it could give itself with a new setting far away from the expectations that came along with previous games.

However, despite the move, it is also undeniably still part of the ongoing Silent Hill canon and there must be some level of link to that within, but whether this will take the form of something so small as a reference in a note or a very literal link between the towns of Silent Hill and Ebisugaoka to explain why the other world appears here as well (or if these links will just be thematic similarities) remains to be seen. While it is expected that many new monsters will be created for this entry there is still some speculation as to what, if any, monsters from previous entries will return or be redesigned for an appearance in Silent Hill f .

5 “Bogeyman”

Stalking Players Until Their Heart Stops

While it seems highly unlikely (thankfully) that the mistakes of old will be repeated and Pyramid Head will be wandering around 1960’s Japan, it would not be at all surprising if there was some central Bogeyman-type figure stalking Hinako throughout the story.

Other than Pyramid Head, there have been several different incarnations of this enemy type within the Silent Hill series such as The Butcher in Silent Hill: Origins or the hammer-wielding Bogeyman in Silent Hill: Downpour .

Furthermore, the popularity of the stalker/recurring enemy in horror has skyrocketed in recent years, undoubtedly owing much to how terrifyingly well the Resident Evil series has realized this archetype in recent years with characters like Jack Baker in Resident Evil 7 and Mr X in the remake of Resident Evil 2 .

4 Nurses

The Core Of Silent Hill's Healthcare

Nurses are a staple of horror media, especially the Silent Hill games, with only three series entries in which they don’t appear ( Shattered Memories , Downpour, and The Room – although the Patient enemy in The Room is very similar) so there is a high chance of their return here in some form or another in Silent Hill f . Perhaps they will appear in the old-fashioned uniforms of the earlier games, or it could be used as an opportunity to draw from the garb of historical Japanese nurses in a redesign of this classic enemy.

As Silent Hill f' s new trailer seems to be indicating the importance, and perhaps merging of, the past in its present setting, the Nurse seems like a fitting enemy to bring back, or perhaps they will even be introduced as the first chronological appearance of the enemy.

3 Sakura Head/Cherry Blossom

The New Freaky Kid On The Scary Block

While it is unlikely that this exact monster will reappear in Silent Hill f, as its manifestation was strongly linked to the story and characters of Silent Hill: The Short Message, it is quite possible that the floral design and perhaps some entity linked to this monster will make an appearance in the series' next entry.

As the Sakura Head was the first new monster to appear as part of the Silent Hill series revival, and the definite linked theme between The Short Message and f is child abuse, it wouldn’t be surprising if a central theme in the design of Sakura Head, such as the floral disfigurements, was also prominent in the enemy design in f . There is a definite similarity between Silent Hill f's Flower Girl and The Short Message's Sakura Heads.

2 Dogs

The Perfidy Of Pets

Another frequently recurring enemy type in the Silent Hill series is variations on a dog-type monster , dating back to the very first Silent Hill . What did all these furry compadres do to wind up in Silent Hill again and again? Repeated piddling on the carpet? Tormenting neighborhood cats? Did they all just forget where their bones were buried?

Sadly, they can’t, or won't, tell, and in a cruel twist of fate, these loyal companions are always opposed against the player character en masse. Maybe Vincent is asking them, “They look like bones to you?” If dogs do return in Silent Hill f , it can only be hoped that they aren’t redesigned as little Shiba Inu’s, although there is a history with that breed and Silent Hill as well.

1 Insects

Nature Can Be Terrifying

Larger than life insects have reappeared in many of the Silent Hill games, sometimes even as bosses, but rarely as anything pleasant. As the town of Ebisugaoka, the setting for Silent Hill f , seems to be somewhat rural and features plenty of rural countryside, the possibility of some giant horrible bug is ever increased.

Previous entries have featured larvae, cockroaches, beetles, worms, moths, macro moths, and more. It may be noted that spiders are not on the list (although there have been spider-like humanoids such as the evolution of the mannequins in the Silent Hill 2 remake) and it can only be hoped that this trend continues and there is not some huge, horrific arachnid awaiting players in Ebisugaoka. It won't remain a very silent hill for long if there are giant spiders awaiting players.

item.title: How to Change Scenery in Clash of Clans
item.description:
Supercell's Clash of Clans is an action-packed mobile game where players can strengthen their empires by placing defenses, traps, resource buildings, and troops around the Town Hall. Besides fortifying their bases against enemy attacks, players may also focus on esthetics by adding cosmetics.

Just like decorations, scenery adds beauty to your base. But more than that, they make your base stand out from others. Depending on your taste, you can choose from fantasy-themed scenery to horror or war-zone ones. For those curious, this guide will show you how to change your Clash of Clans scenery and how to get more of them.

How To Change Scenery In Clash of Clans

Initially, all players start with the regular Classic scenery, but over time, it might become pretty boring for some. So, changing it up is a great way to give your empire a fresh look and make gameplay more exciting. Thankfully, swapping between scenery isn't too technical, so any player can do it in seconds.

To change your scenery in Clash of Clans , just head to your Home Village (which is your main hub) and click on the Town Hall . Once done, you'll see the 'Change Scenery' option in the bottom menu. So, all you need to do is tap on it and pick your favorite theme from the pop-up screen. As you collect more scenery, you'll have more options for your base. They’ll all appear under the Home Village section, so make sure to check that. If you're unsure which one would look best for your village, just hit the blue eye icon to preview it on your base.

Just so you know, scenery doesn’t affect your troops' performance or add anything extra than you already have to your base. It just changes the background around your empire, so pick one that truly matches your style.

How To Get More Scenery In Clash of Clans

There are two main ways to get scenery in Clash of Clans — one is free, and the other is paid. Here's a breakdown of each way:

Upgrade Your Town Hall

The first method to collect more scenery is by leveling up in the game. As of now, Clash of Clans offers only three free scenery to players. And to obtain them, you'll need to upgrade your Town Hall to the required level. Below is a list of all the free themes you can choose for your empire in the game:

Home Village Scenery

Requirement To Unlock Them

Classic Scenery

Default

Jungle Scenery

Reach Town Hall Level 14

Magic Scenery

Hit Town Hall Level 15

Buy From The Game Shop

Another way to get more scenery in Clash of Clans is by purchasing it from the Game Shop. This is a paid method, so you'll need to spend real money to get these exclusive designs. In the Shop, check under 'Cosmetics' or 'Special Offers' to see the latest available themes.

item.title: Baldur's Gate 3: Best Summons To Prioritize In The Final Battle
item.description:
In Baldur's Gate 3 , the final battle against the Netherbrain is the culmination of every major choice, alliance, and bond forged throughout your epic journey . As the Netherbrain rises to exert its control over the people of Faerûn and other realms, hope hinges on your ability to challenge the brain and save Baldur's Gate from the brink of annihilation.

While your party takes on the Netherbrain by themselves, the allies you've gained throughout your journey are also more than willing to strengthen your assault against the Absolute . Depending on which allies you've gathered in your playthrough, here are the best summons you should consider prioritizing in the final battle.

Best Summons To Call Upon Against The Netherbrain's Forces

With over 20 summonable allies at your disposal , it's essential to know who packs the most power and utility to tip the scales in your favor. To help you prioritize, below is a breakdown of the best summons you can call upon in the final battle, based on their effectiveness and strategic value:

Summon

Role

Why It's Great

Mizora

Spellcaster (Control/DPS)

High damage, Metamagic, controllable

Isobel

Healer

Massive, wide-area healing

Kith’rak Voss

Battlefield Control/Damage

Long-lasting, high-damage fire wall

Ironhand Grenadiers

AOE Damage/Disruption

Blinding + AOE coverage

Zanner Toobin’s Steel Watcher

Tank/Explosive Damage

Resistant, mobile, big explosion

Yurgir

Battlefield Control/Distraction

Invisbility

Dame Aylin

Tank/Support

Buffs, tanky, versatile

Firestorm (Rolan/Larroakan)

Burst DPS

Great against key enemies

Astarion’s Vampire Minions

Swarm/Distraction

Extra bodies, absorb hits

Zevlor & Hellriders

Frontline NPCs

Solid, but lack player control

Mizora, Agent of Avernus

Mizora is one of the powerful evil allies you can have on your side in the final battle. She plays the role of a sorcerer and brings a variety of powerful spells to the table, including Haste , Disintegrate , and Command . She also has access to Metamagic with 12 sorcery points , allowing you to cast Twinned Spells, which can be quite useful for concentrating Haste on two companions.

Since she is a player-controlled ally, using Mizora to concentrate on spells while protecting her with Sanctuary can be incredibly powerful.

Balm Of The Moonmaiden

You can call upon Isobel's help to bestow 14d6 healing upon six allies . You should consider using this potent healing in dire situations, especially when some of your allies are on the brink of death. Fortunately, your allies don't necessarily have to be grouped together to benefit from the spell, as the Balm of the Moonmaiden has a generous 80 ft radius.

Kith'raki Inferno

Kith'rak Voss can be summoned to aid you in the final battle with his Kith'raki Inferno wall of fire, which lasts for 10 turns and deals 12d6 fire damage to any caught in it . The wall of fire can be used to control the battlefield, allowing you to stall enemy aggression. Additionally, you can use the wall of fire to take out the mind flayers that sit back and hurl Magic Missile at your party and allies.

Ironhand Grenadiers

You acquire the Ironhand Grenadiers as summons by helping Barcus Wroot or Wulbren Bongle destroy the Steel Watch Foundry. These grenadiers are excellent for dealing massive AOE damage with their smokepowder arrows and causing a blinding effect on enemies.

The Ironhand Grenadiers are especially useful in the battle atop the Netherbrain, where you'll face the dominated red dragon, several mind flayers, and powerful spellcasters.

Gondian Steel Watcher

Zanner Toobin offers his allyship by letting you summon a re-calibrated Steel Watcher, a construct that is resistant to spells and has advantage on Dexterity saving throws . The Steel Watcher can cover double the distance in a single turn and its failsafe protocol also causes it to self-destruct, dealing massive AOE damage to nearby creatures.

Hellstalker Yurgir

Yurgir is another powerful evil ally who's great at stopping enemies in their tracks. The infernal Orthon has powerful actions at his disposal, including the ability to turn invisible with a bonus action each turn. Some of Yurgir's abilities let you control the battlefield by knocking enemies prone or imposing disadvantage on attack rolls with his poisoning strikes.

Sword Of The Silverlight

Dame Aylin is another controllable ally you can call upon for assistance in the final battle. She has access to several useful spells, including Lunar Blessing, Lunar Smite, and Fly , all of which help her slow down enemies, draw their aggression, and buy you valuable time to reach the Netherbrain.

Rolan's Firestorm/ Larroakan's Firestom

Depending on the choices you made in Act 3, you'll either have access to Rolan's Firestorm or Larroakan's Firestorm AOE abilities . Despite the change in name, these summons are identical. The Firestorm is exceptional for dealing massive single-target damage or small AOE fire and force damage. You should consider reserving it for powerful enemies like the Emperor or the dominated red dragon.

Retinue Of The Vampire Lore

If you help Astarion ascend into the Vampire Lord, he'll return the favor by summoning two shadows, two giant skeletons, a werewolf, a ghast, and a shadow mastiff . While these summons aren't quite as powerful, they are especially good at offering additional targets for enemies to focus on, which can buy you time to reach the brain.

Hellrider Platoon

If you rescued Zevlor in Act 2, you can call upon his might to thwart the forces of Netherbrain. Zevlor brings along with him a Hellrider Paladin and a Hellrider Cleric . These summons are great counters to the powerful spellcasters that fight under the brain's command. It’s worth noting that Zevlor fights as an NPC and cannot be controlled by the player.

item.title: The 8 Best Final Fantasy 7 Remake Mods For Tifa
item.description:
Summary

  • Tifa mods range from cosmetic changes like short hair to changing behavioral patterns.
  • Aggressive Companions mod enhances the AI behavior, a non-cosmetic change in gameplay.
  • Mods like Sailor Moon outfits offer fun styles for Tifa, enhancing player customization.

Tifa Lockhart is a particularly popular character from the Final Fantasy series, so it’s no surprise that plenty of mods for the Final Fantasy 7 Remake revolve around her. A good portion of the player-made mods for Tifa are based around cosmetic changes, such as hair changes or different outfits for her. However, some mods change how Tifa and the other companions in the game behave, which can change the flow of battle entirely.

Despite not affecting gameplay, there is a lot to enjoy about cosmetic mods as well. Changing a character's look can make things feel more personalized. This can also be fun or silly, depending on what kind of mod players opt for. The following are noteworthy Final Fantasy 7 Remake mods for Tifa that are well worth installing, especially for players who are fond of her character.

1 Tifa Short Hair

Created by Gojeeb

  • Mod link
  • Over 36,300 downloads

The short-hair Tifa mod does exactly what the name suggests: it gives Tifa a new, shortened hairstyle in the game. There isn’t much to it except that, but it is impressive how well-detailed the mod is.

There are also variations when it comes to the hairstyle, as the mod has two short haircuts that can be used for Tifa. It can also be used with other outfits, including outfit mods such as the Cowgirl Tifa mod or the Yuna outfit mod. Before players use this mod, they will need to have two other mods installed: 3dMigoto and FFHook. Be sure to install them first before you opt for this mod.

2 Aggressive Companions

Created by gladias9

  • Mod link
  • Over 58,100 downloads

Next is a mod that affects all companions in the Final Fantasy 7 Remake , including Tifa. As the name suggests, the focus of this mod is to increase the aggressiveness of companions during combat. This is because companions tend to stand around rather than actively defend or attack.

This is a useful mod for players who are frustrated by the AI’s behavior in the game. It is also the only non-cosmetic mod on this list, so it stands out from the crowd.

3 Sailor Moon Outfits

Created by Jujub

  • Mod link
  • Over 9,900 downloads

Fans of the world-renowned magical girl anime Sailor Moon are sure to enjoy this next mod, which gives three of the central characters outfits from the series.

Tifa’s outfit is based on the character Rei Hino, also known by her magical girl alter ego Sailor Mars. Tifa’s look fits with the character well, thanks to their matching long, dark hair and similar general appearance.

The cool thing about this mod is that it recreates the outfits from Sailor Moon with assets already available in the game. The assets have been combined pretty perfectly, making for outfits that are instantly recognizable and that suit the characters, including Tifa, very well.

4 Tifa Hyper HD Texture Pack

Created by SweetFluff3D

  • Mod link
  • Over 28,400 downloads

The hyper HD texture pack mod is also cosmetic, but it is more of a high-definition upgrade than an all-new look for Tifa.

With this mod, the textures of Tifa’s standard outfit get an 8k resolution upgrade. It makes a significant difference to Tifa’s look, giving her a more realistic vibe thanks to the impressive definition of her outfit. For those who like to make the most out of the visuals in a game, this is a great choice of mod for Tifa.

5 Tifa Customizer

Created by snipe

  • Mod link
  • Over 13,400 downloads

Players who want to customize Tifa in a variety of ways can do so with this hair, skin, and eye customization mod. The mod offers a range of different eye, hair, and skin tones for Tifa, so players can mix and match to create their own take on her character.

There are 18 options for eye colors, 22 hair colors, and 12 skin colors to choose from, allowing players to make a truly unique Tifa for their playthrough. Players have also transformed Tifa into other existing characters with this mod, such as making her look like She-Hulk from Marvel Comics or Starfire from Teen Titans .

6 Tifa Advent Children Outfit

Created by Ninjagrime

  • Mod link
  • Over 30,000 downloads

Final Fantasy 7: Advent Children is a popular animated film from 2005 that takes place two years after the events of Final Fantasy 7 . Despite receiving mixed reviews when it was released, it became a cult classic for fans of the Final Fantasy series. With this mod, players can dress Tifa in the outfit that she wears in the Advent Children film.

This mod changes Tifa’s standard outfit to a texture based on her Advent Children design. The base model for her is also gloveless and has no suspenders, making Tifa look more similar to how she does in the film.

7 Tifa Rocker Outfit

Created by Yic17

  • Mod link
  • Over 7,900 downloads

A cute and stylish cosmetic mod for Tifa is the Rocker Outfit mod, which offers three color variations for a cool rock-themed outfit. Players can choose from a pink-haired Tifa with black and white clothing, a silver-haired Tifa with red and black clothing, or a blonde Tifa with yellow and black clothing. Tifa also has short hair with this mod, no matter which color variation is chosen.

The mod changes the textures of Tifa’s base outfit to give her a punk-rock look, with a checkered skirt and various rock-like motifs on her outfit, such as fishnet stockings with red and black color variations. Not only are these textures very well-made, but they also suit Tifa’s character and design, mixing well with the general shape and style of her usual outfit.

8 Tifa Morrigan Aensland Cosplay

Created by MonkeyMan Mods

  • Mod link
  • Over 10,000 downloads

Last but not least is a brilliantly made costume mod that dresses Tifa like the character Morrigan Aensland from the Dalkstalkers Capcom video game series. Morrigan has a very specific look, with long teal hair, bat wings on her back and head, and a purple and black outfit. This mod recreates Morrigan’s appearance with great detail, making it perfect for fans of both Final Fantasy 7 and Darksiders . Even Tifa’s body model has been altered to make her more accurate to the character, as her hips are wider to suit Morrigan’s look.

Players can choose to remove the wings from the outfit in case they are having problems with clipping. Both the head wings and the rear wings can be removed via downloads of separate mods.

item.title: 9 Best Star Wars Games That Let You Be A Stormtrooper
item.description:
For decades, Stormtroopers have remained one of the most recognizable soldier types in Star Wars and fiction as a whole. Although known for their poor aim in the movies, Stormtroopers are often depicted as highly capable soldiers in other Star Wars media, showcasing their rigorous training, discipline, and combat efficiency.

In video games, players can truly experience the abilities and skills of Stormtroopers by stepping into their iconic white armor and witnessing firsthand what it’s like to fight for the Empire. In this article, we will look at the ten best Star Wars games that let you be a Stormtrooper.

9 Star Wars: Hunters

The Mobile Hero Shooter

Despite a somewhat rocky launch, with many players hoping for a full console and PC experience rather than a mobile game, Star Wars: Hunters has developed a thriving fan base. The 4v4 hero shooter has a roster of many interesting characters, and a fan favorite is the Stormtrooper known as Sentinel.

Sentinel is what you would expect from a Stormtrooper, with a loud-mouth and arrogant personality. Equipped with an E-Web Heavy Repeater, Sentinel packs a punch and is one of the most capable Stormtrooper characters in Star Wars media. Star Wars: Hunters have surprisingly great gameplay, but players will need to make sure they select Sentinel first to have a chance at playing him.

Star Wars: Hunters will be shutting down in October, 2026.

8 Lego Star Wars: The Complete Saga

A Charming Star Wars Experience in Adorable and Comedic LEGO Form

Lego Star Wars: The Complete Saga is one of the most popular Lego games of all time, letting fans play through Star Wars episodes 1–6 in the charming Lego playstyle. Although the heroes are the main focus of the game, fans can play as Stormtroopers in the bonus levels as well as Freeplay.

There are four main Stormtrooper variants that players can choose from: the classic Stormtrooper, Sandtrooper, Snowtrooper, and the humorous Beach Trooper. Players can also create their own versions in the character customizer, like Jedi Stormtroopers. Stormtroopers also play a key role in the game with ‘Imperial Access’ allowing them to unlock doors and access new areas.

7 Star Wars Battlefront: Renegade Squadron

The First Handheld Star Wars Battlefront Title

Star Wars Battlefront: Renegade Squadron , released exclusively for the PSP in 2007, remains one of the best handheld experiences in the Star Wars franchise. The game was essentially Star Wars Battlefront 2 , but solely designed for the PSP, and with a campaign focused on the Rebel Alliance instead of the 501st Legion.

Fans can play as Stormtroopers in the Instant Action and Assult game mode, and for the first time in the battlefront series, players were able to customize their characters. This inclusion made for some genuinely refreshing gameplay, allowing players to select unique weapons and cosmetics.

6 Star Wars Battlefront (2004)

The First Star Wars Battlefront is a Timeless Classic

Star Wars Battlefront (2004) was the first entry to the iconic Star Wars Battlefront series. The game was the first of its kind for the Star Wars franchise, allowing players to jump into both classic and never-before-seen battles in the Star Wars galaxy.

Stormtroopers are the main focus in a select few campaign missions and can be played in Instant Action and Galactic Conquest. The gameplay is what you'd expect from a third/first-person shooter from 2004, but it still holds up to this day and inspired many great games, including the 2015 reboot.

5 Lego Star Wars: The Skywalker Saga

The Ultimate Star Wars Experience in LEGO Form

Lego Star Wars: The Skywalker Saga is the ultimate Lego Star Wars experience. For the first time, fans can explore all three of the Star Wars trilogies in one game, as well as play as characters from TV Shows like The Mandalorian and Star Wars: The Clone Wars .

Players can explore 23 different planets and play as over 300 different characters. With the inclusion of the Sequel Trilogy, fans can play as First-Order Stormtroopers as well as classic Imperial Stormtroopers. With over 10 unique Stormtrooper variants, players can enforce the Emperor's wrath in style across the Star Wars galaxy.

4 Star Wars Battlefront: Elite Squadron

The First Battlefront Title With Direct Ground-to-Space Combat

Star Wars Battlefront: Elite Squadron is the fourth installment in the Battlefront series and the sequel to Star Wars Battlefront: Renegade Squadron . The story follows two force-sensitive Clone Troopers, created from the DNA of a Jedi Master. Players play as X2, who defect from the Empire shortly after becoming a Stormtrooper.

Star Wars Battlefront: Elite Squadron was initially meant to be released as Star Wars Battlefront 3 with PS3, PS2, and Wii versions; however, it entirely ended up as a PSP and DS exclusive. Despite the setback, Elite Squadron has one of the most sought-after Battlefront features with almost seamless ground-to-space combat, something that hasn't returned to the Battlefront series since.

3 Star Wars: Battlefront (2015)

The Reboot Of The Battlefront Series

Star Wars: Battlefront from 2015 was the reboot of the original Battlefront series and was released on PS4, Xbox One, and PC. Unlike previous Battlefront titles, Star Wars: Battlefront (2015) focused solely on the Original Trilogy era, perfect for some fans but not so great for others. With the Original Trilogy in mind, characters like Stormtroopers were the main focus and the character models had great attention to detail.

The game felt much more cinematic and immersive than other Battlefront titles and had some great DLC, like the Outer Rim, Bespin, Death Star, and Rouge One: Scarif expansions. The Walker Assault game mode on the planet Hoth is still regarded as one of the best Star Wars gaming experiences of all time.

2 Star Wars: Battlefront 2 (2005)

The Classic Star Wars Game to Blend Prequels and Originals

Star Wars: Battlefront 2 from 2005 is a fan-favorite Star Wars game and is often regarded as one of the best Star Wars games of all time. Perhaps the most notable aspect of the game is the campaign, which follows Clone Troopers and then Stormtroopers as they come to terms with the fall of the Republic and the rise of the Empire.

Players can choose between the Clone Wars and the Galactic Civil War era and play on over 20 unique maps. The roster of Heroes and Villains is great while allowing standard troopers like Stormtroopers to feel strong. With the release of the Star Wars: Battlefront Classic Collection in early 2024, the game has seen a surge of new players diving into this classic title.

1 Star Wars: Battlefront 2 (2017)

The Ultimate Star Wars Experience

Despite the controversial launch with the game full of microtransactions and paywalls, Star Wars: Battlefront 2 (2017) had one of the best redemptions in gaming history and has become a fan's favorite Star Wars game ever since. Star Wars: Battlefront 2 is the ultimate Star Wars experience, allowing players to experience all three Star Wars trilogies.

Star Wars: Battlefront 2 offers over 10 game modes that cover various eras, allowing players to relive many iconic Star Wars battles as well as unique experiences like Ewok Hunt. With its polished graphics, character customization, loadout options, and versatility, it stands out as the best game for players looking to experience what it's like to be a Stormtrooper.
